Jubilant FoodWorks Limited provides information on workplace accidents and fatalities in its Integrated Annual Report for the year ended 31st March 2024, specifically highlighting Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR), Total recordable work-related injuries, Number of fatalities, and High consequence work-related injury or ill-health. The report notes that these figures are work-related. Although I couldn't access the company's website to find the policies, the provided document does not contain information regarding workplace accidents or labor fatalities. Therefore, considering the publicly disclosed safety statistics and absence of relevant information in the Memorandum and Articles of Association, I scored this 2, indicating that the company has publicly disclosed its health and safety policies and provided information on the number of employee accidents.

The document focuses on the company's Memorandum and Articles of Association, but it does contain information about the company's policies and mechanisms to prevent sexual harassment at the workplace. Specifically, the annual report (page 72) mentions that the company has adopted a policy in compliance with the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 ('POSH Act'). This information suggests that the policy regarding sexual harassment is publicly disclosed. Although the name of the policy itself is not explicitly stated in the provided text, the report notes that periodic sessions were conducted to build awareness on the subject and that an Internal Complaints Committee ('ICC') was constituted to address complaints regarding sexual harassment. According to the Jubilant FoodWorks Limited Integrated Annual Report (March 31, 2024), there is no mention of delayed repayments to lenders, creditors, or suppliers. However, the report indicates that the company is generally regular in depositing undisputed statutory dues (page 241). There's also discussion of trade payables having an average settlement term of six months (page 198) and trade receivables with an average collection period of around 51 days (page 109). These details, however, do not indicate any *delayed* payments. Additionally, the CRISIL credit rating report does not mention any delayed repayments to lenders, creditors, or suppliers. Although there is no information indicating delayed payment to lenders, it is noted that the company has delayed payment to its suppliers and vendors (referencing the reports for 2022 and 2023).

I could not find any explicit mention of ethics policy or code of conduct in the provided document, Memorandum and Articles of Association of Jubilant FoodWorks Limited. The document only outlines the company's objectives and legal structure but does not delve into internal policies or procedures related to ethical conduct, conflict resolution, or anti-corruption/anti-bribery measures. It is impossible to definitively say whether the company demonstrates a commitment to strong ethical practices or has specific procedures for dealing with conflicts of interest, third-party interactions, or disciplinary action for ethics violations.

Jubilant FoodWorks Limited spent ₹99.60 million on CSR activities in the financial year ending March 31, 2024, which represents 2.49% of their consolidated profit of ₹4,007.52 million (Source: Jubilant FoodWorks Limited, Integrated Annual Report 2023-24, page 64). This percentage is greater than 0.02 times of their profit, so we score it as 2. In the previous years, the company's CSR spending as a percentage of their profit after tax was also above 0.02% (2.55% in FY 2023 and 2.009% in FY 2022).

The independent auditor's reports (both consolidated and standalone, pages 149-154 and 216-220 respectively) do **not** contain any qualified opinions or emphasis of matter. There is no mention of an auditor resigning due to a difference of opinion or for any suspicious reason. The auditor's report expresses an unmodified opinion on the standalone and consolidated financial statements.

No information available on whether the company has a dedicated policy for related party transactions or if it includes definitions of ordinary business, materiality of transaction, and requirement of such transaction reviewed by external auditor.
